snippet: The free-standing emergency room, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, is part of a trend that provides acute care but also helps a hospital’s bottom line.
abstract: North Shore-Long Island Jewish Health System is opening free-standing emergency room in building that was once part of St Vincent's Hospital in West Village; ER, to be called Lenox Hill HealthPlex to denote its relationship with North Shore's hospital on the Upper East Side, is part of growing trend across country and has as much to do with a hospital's bottom line as providing acute care.
lead_paragraph: The free-standing emergency room, Lenox Hill HealthPlex, is part of a trend that provides acute care but also helps a hospital’s bottom line.

headline.main: An E.R., Not a Hospital, Is Set to Open at St. Vincent’s Site
headline.print_headline: E.R., Not a Hospital, Is Set to Open at St. Vincent’s Site
